article: There is a measurable relation between how much a person learns and that individual's attitude toward the subject to be learned. When faced with a difficult learning assignment, one _ toward success is to seek out and concentrate on the positive aspects of the subject matter. If a student has a(n) _ and ineffective teacher in a required course, one _ is to look for the positive aspects of completing the course, regardless of how boring the instructor happens to be. To _ this might require a private tutor or some _ reading, but with the right _ , success is possible.  _ --those students who do better than their test scores-- _ have a positive interest toward learning. They may learn some things more slowly, and it may take more effort, but, to compensate, they are often better at _ what they have learned. As long as they do not stress themselves into _ problems, they are successful. Under-achievers--those who function _ their ability indicated by test scores--often tend to permit a few _ factors to sidetrack them. Because of their negative attitudes, they sometimes become unfairly _ f teachers. They allow themselves to get bored when it is not necessary. In short , their attitudes often cause them to learn less than overachievers. If you learn to _ a negative mind with a positive one--set toward learning with something more positive, you are on the road to _ virtually any goal you desire. For example, if you realize a personal computer with a word processor would improve your _ , but have an attitude that keeps telling you that you cannot learn to operate a computer you tend to make all kinds of _ . In short, you resist making full use of a terrific tool, _ because your negative attitude prevents you from learning.
